image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: Israel intercepts 100 Iranian UAVs; strikes Tehran's refuelling jet in Mashhad- latest updates
item.description: The IDF reported intercepting over 100 Iranian UAVs launched towards Israel, while Iranian security forces claimed to discover a secret Israeli drone factory within Iran. Israel's strikes targeted Iranian nuclear scientists, military officials, and weapon production sites, including those belonging to the Quds Force. Amidst the escalating conflict, Israeli citizens are advised to remain near shelters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Arturo Gamboa? Armed man at Kings Day protest fired at by peacekeeper; bystander killed
item.description: During a "No Kings" protest in Salt Lake City, a peacekeeper opened fire on a man who raised a rifle toward the crowd, tragically killing a bystander. The incident led to panic and a police investigation into the man's motives and the peacekeepers' training. Separately, in Riverside, California, a driver struck a protester and fled the scene.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Sometimes they have to fight it out': Trump says Iran-Israel will fight before peace; offers help
item.description: Amid escalating military strikes between Iran and Israel, US President Donald Trump urged both nations to negotiate a deal, acknowledging potential continued conflict beforehand. Recent clashes mark a dangerous escalation, with direct strikes replacing proxy warfare, raising concerns of a broader Middle East war. Trump hinted at behind-the-scenes efforts towards peace, expressing optimism for a future agreement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Saudi Arabia: No Umrah visa without approved hotel booking, what pilgrims must Know
item.description: Saudi Arabia has implemented a new policy, effective June 10, 2025, requiring all Umrah pilgrims to have confirmed hotel bookings via the Nusuk Masar platform before visa issuance. This initiative aims to protect pilgrims' rights, eliminate fraudulent housing practices, and ensure high accommodation standards. The move aligns with Saudi Vision 2030, integrating digital innovation to enhance the pilgrimage experience.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Want a UAE Golden Visa as a student? Hereâ€™s the eligibility criteria, required documents, top universities, and how to apply online
item.description: The UAE Golden Visa program attracts and retains global talent by offering a 10-year residency to high-achieving graduates in priority fields like science and technology. Eligibility includes graduates with a minimum GPA of 3.5 from top-ranked universities. Abu Dhabi also provides custom Golden Visa tracks for high school and university graduates meeting specific academic criteria, fostering innovation and growth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: â€˜Just like I got India, Pak to dealâ€™: Trump says he can end Israel-Iran war, â€˜peace soonâ€™
item.description: Amid escalating Israeli airstrikes on Iran, US President Donald Trump claimed he could broker peace, citing his past success in de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. Trump said on Truth Social that a deal between Iran and Israel is achievable, similar to his intervention with India and Pakistan. As fighting continues in the Middle East, Trump said heâ€™s been taking calls and holding meetings behind the scenes.

item.description: â€‹The tipping point? A perfect storm of political pressure, survivor testimony, community backlashâ€”and unusually, a global spotlight powered by Elon Musk, who used his platform, X (formerly Twitter), to repeatedly target Starmerâ€™s record on grooming gangs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Can I please have a cigarette?' Drunk woman on Delta plane refuses to get down, forces others to deboard
item.description: A Delta flight from Dallas to Boston faced significant delays when an intoxicated passenger, Alicia, refused to deboard. After consuming six glasses of wine, she became uncooperative, leading to police intervention and the deplaning of all passengers. Alicia's disruptive behavior, including spitting and resisting arrest, resulted in charges of criminal trespassing and public intoxication.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Far left is murderously violent': Is Minnesota shooting suspect Vance Luther Boelter a Democrat?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Five dead, two missing in Typhoon Wutip in central Vietnam, farmlands flooded; reaches southern China
item.description: Typhoon Wutip has wreaked havoc in central Vietnam, resulting in five deaths and leaving two missing, according to the agriculture ministry. The storm submerged over 70,000 hectares of cropland, causing widespread flooding. Wutip, after hitting southern China and weakening, is expected to dissipate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel's 'Operation Rising Lion': Donald Trump denies US role; Iran claims 'solid proof' of American support
item.description: Iran claims to possess evidence implicating US forces in supporting recent Israeli airstrikes, particularly targeting the Natanz nuclear site. US President Trump denied any American involvement, warning Iran against retaliation while suggesting a potential deal between Iran and Israel. The US Secretary of State also stated that US has no role to play in Israeli attacks on Iran.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Minnesota lawmakers shot: What was found in gunman's car? AK-style rifle, â€˜No Kingsâ€™ flyers and more
item.description: A manhunt is underway in Minnesota for Vance Boelter, suspected of fatally shooting a former House Speaker and her husband, and wounding a state Senator and his wife. The suspect, who impersonated a police officer, had "No Kings" flyers, linked to anti-Trump protests, in his vehicle.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
